titleStmt.title: The famous, true and historicall life of Robert second Duke of Normandy, surnamed for his monstrous birth and behauiour, Robin the Diuell VVherein is contained his dissolute life in his youth, his deuout reconcilement and vertues in his age: interlaced with many straunge and miraculous aduentures. VVherein are both causes of profite, and manie conceits of pleasure. By T.L. G.
titleStmt.author: Lodge, Thomas, 1558?-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: [By Thomas Orwin] for N[icholas] L[ing] and Iohn Busbie, and are to be sold at the west dore of Paules,

notesStmt.note: Based on STC 21070, a translation of: Robert le diable.
Running title reads: The historie of Robert second Duke of Normandy.
Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
